context: You would hardly be in a position to put him in front of a jury to make an absolute identification.
response: At the moment, I'm more interested in learning how this trap was set.
context/0: Mr. Prosecutor, you must admit that the testimony of this witness has become hopelessly impaired.
context/1: That's what I wanted to know.
context/4: The point is, Mr. Keddie, can you swear that the woman you picked up on Sunset wasn't the defendant?
context/5: I can't remember them too well.
context/6: You pick up a lot of people.
context/7: Well, you know how it is.
context/8: Was one of those women this defendant?
context/9: They got out and paid off.

context: You ought to know that the conversation between a doctor and a patient is privileged.
response: Did he tell you then that he wanted to die or rather that he wanted to have it appear that he had died?
context/3: Now, had you ever seen Mr. Davenport before you treated him at the Vista Motel?
context/4: I should like you to remember, doctor, that you're under oath.
context/6: Had he ever consulted you at your office?
context/7: I don't understand.
context/8: Had you ever seen Mr. Davenport before you were called in?
context/9: I live just around the corner.

context/1: That's where I happened to be roving at the time.
context/2: Well, I'm a roving reporter now and I...
context/3: I find it remarkable how you gentleman of the press arrived at the spot so quickly.
context/4: By the way,
context/6: Please drink up and pay up.
context/7: Time, gentleman.
context/9: Come on now, Sergeant, we're talking about progress and you can't report anything because you haven't made any.
